results.title: The Full bell curve
results.creator_credit: Paula Pippin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Paula Pippin and her husband told their friends they were moving to the country, the responses ranged from suspicion to outright hostility. But the Pippin family were on an adventure which would introduce them to the full bell curve of society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paula Pippin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Paula Pippin and her husband told their friends they were moving to the country, the responses ranged from suspicion to outright hostility. But the Pippin family were on an adventure which would introduce them to the full bell curve of society.

results.title: Dust dance
results.creator_credit: Judy Griffiths, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 2000. Judy Griffiths took over her family farm. Having studied agriculture science, Griffiths was able to apply what she learnt to help her care for the land through some of the toughest times her farm has ever seen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Judy Griffiths, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Ants in the irrigation drippers
results.creator_credit: Jeanette Holloway, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 1976, Jeanette and Arthur Holloway took over Arthur’s family farm in Chiltern, Victoria. There they began a partnership with two other families to grow kiwi fruit. Jeanette Holloway recounts the time there, the hardships and how the farm became her home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeanette Holloway, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: In 1976, Jeanette and Arthur Holloway took over Arthur’s family farm in Chiltern, Victoria. There they began a partnership with two other families to grow kiwi fruit. Jeanette Holloway recounts the time there, the hardships and how the farm became her home.

results.title: Adapt to change or leave the land
results.creator_credit: Tom Carroll, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As Tom Carroll reflects on five generations of his family and their land at Mudgeegonga in northern Victoria. In doing so, he recalls the various challenges his ancestors faced, as well as the changes they needed to accomodate, much in the same way he has to today.
results.title_for_label: Adapt to change or leave the land
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Carroll, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: As Tom Carroll reflects on five generations of his family and their land at Mudgeegonga in northern Victoria. In doing so, he recalls the various challenges his ancestors faced, as well as the changes they needed to accomodate, much in the same way he has to today.

results.title: Train the trainer : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Ten stories from the general public that were compiled and produced as part of the Digital Storytelling ‘Train the Trainer’ program at ACMI. The stories are mostly biographical, usually centred around an memorable or life-changing event, or dedicated to someone the participants find inspirational.
results.description: Ten stories from the general public that were compiled and produced as part of the Digital Storytelling ‘Train the Trainer’ program at ACMI. The stories are mostly biographical, usually centred around an memorable or life-changing event, or dedicated to someone the participants find inspirational.
description_for_label: Ten stories from the general public that were compiled and produced as part of the Digital Storytelling ‘Train the Trainer’ program at ACMI. The stories are mostly biographical, usually centred around an memorable or life-changing event, or dedicated to someone the participants find inspirational.

results.title: Three cows
results.creator_credit: Gavin Bannerman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gavin Bannerman grew up on a farm out of Brisbane. The Bannermans had a deal with the local butcher for their cattle and every season they would either have a fridge full of meat or a tidy sum. One day, they decided to name their cows.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gavin Bannerman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Gavin Bannerman grew up on a farm out of Brisbane. The Bannermans had a deal with the local butcher for their cattle and every season they would either have a fridge full of meat or a tidy sum. One day, they decided to name their cows.

results.title: Scooter girl
results.creator_credit: Melissa McLachlan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Melissa McLachlan considers the advantages of having a scooter to get to work and the social benefits. The scooter is much more than a mode of transport for McLachlan.

results.title: Remembering
results.creator_credit: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Laura Brearley’s dear friend died of cancer, Brearley took solace in her art, her music and remembering. In doing this, Brearley gave the gift of comfort to many others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.creator_credit: Vanessa James, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
